text:
I don't know if this is mentioned before. I'm using JMeter for a dynamic web 
test and I find it a excellent tool. But when I try using regular expression 
extractor, i remarked that the reference's scope was just limited to the next 
request. This's very annoying if someone must use the reference more than once 
in the test. The only workaround is copying the reference before EVERY 
request... Can the scope be extended to the whole test?
Thank you for your attention.
Sincerely,
creator: xiajiacs@hotmail.com

text: I think this is user error, not a jmeter bug.  All references are global in scope.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Hi All,

I am also facing the same problem, the value extracted using a Regular 
Expression Extractor is accessible only for the very next request....

But is not available for all of the requests.

As such there doesnt looks to be any scope restriction....since it should be 
global by default.

So i shall appreciate if i could get a solution for this...If its an error at 
the user end. Can you suggest what are the parameters that i should check.

let me write the tree how it is...

Simple Controller1
    Request1
           Regular Exp. Extractor (REE)
    HTML1
           REE accessible
    HTML2
           REE not accessible

So please suggest where i am going wrong...and what is the issue.

Thanks
Senthil
creator: senthil_sk3@hotmail.com

text:
Well, I am using v2.0.1 and when i was trying to group the samplers. I was not 
able to use the extracted value for all the HTTP Requests.

When i tried again...with not grouping the samplers...I was able to access the 
extracted value...

So I am not sure...if this is the exact reason for the scope restriction.

Since this work-around is solving the current issue. I am going ahead with it.
I shall update..if i progress on the issue.
